avatar.alt: Avatar of Edain Jesus Cortez Ceron

introduction.paragraph:
Hello, I'm Edain Jesús Cortez Cerón, a software engineer and full stack developer with over five years of experience. I specialize in creating web and mobile applications, as well as scalable backend servers, using technologies like React, Spring, React Native, Vue.js, Laravel, and Django, among others. My education at the Universidad Autónoma de Guerrero and my experience in projects for public and private institutions have allowed me to tackle solutions from architecture to user experience.
One of my notable achievements is UAGro App, a mobile platform with over 10,000 active users, developed in React Native and Laravel.
Currently, I work as a freelancer while improving my English to participate in international projects. My goal is to create impactful, functional solutions.

Contact me, and let's explore how I can contribute to your next project!

list.title: UAGro App
list.subtitle: Official Application of the Autonomous University of Guerrero
list.description: The official application designed to facilitate access to relevant information from the Autonomous University of Guerrero. With a focus on usability, it allows users to check grades, explore educational offerings, and access official programs and departments. It includes the updated menu of the university cafeteria, the latest news and events, and management of academic activities from anywhere through a secure login. Developed in TypeScript and React Native for the frontend, and a robust backend in Laravel with an Oracle database, UAGro App offers an intuitive and efficient experience for the university community.

list.title: ANUIES
list.subtitle: Prospecting System for Expanding Higher Education Offerings
list.description: Government website developed for the National Association of Universities and Higher Education Institutions (ANUIES). The system has three modules that help State Commissions for Higher Education Planning (COEPES) analyze local educational offerings in upper secondary and higher education. It facilitates the prospecting of enrollment growth in higher education through an algorithm designed by ANUIES and allows for setting goals and strategies for each state, as well as sharing best practices among states.

list.title: Informe UAGro
list.subtitle: Web and Mobile Platform for Managing the 2024 UAGro Report Event
list.description: Informe UAGro is a mobile application and web platform designed for the report event of the Autonomous University of Guerrero. Developed with React, React Native, and Laravel, it offers a secure, encrypted, and reusable environment for managing invitations through unique tokens, as well as sending personalized emails. It uses MySQL as a database and Tailwind CSS for responsive design. Additionally, it incorporates DomPDF for generating unique and personalized invitations in PDF format and React-QR for creating QR codes, thereby facilitating access to relevant information during the event.

company.name: Design and Accessibility System for Research

list.description: In collaboration with the National Council of Science and Technology (Conacyt) and the Faculty of Chemical Biological Sciences of the Autonomous University of Guerrero (UAGro), I develop accessible web pages for the Design and Accessibility System for Research (SISDAI), using technologies such as Vue.js and JavaScript. Additionally, I act as an intermediary between both institutions, facilitating communication and coordination between teams via Slack. This part-time project has allowed me to combine both technical and management skills, significantly contributing to the success of the system and improving accessibility for researchers and scientists.

company.name: General Directorate of Innovation and Digital Technologies

list.description: I have actively participated in various technology development projects, including the creation of websites, mobile applications, servers, and databases. With a multidisciplinary approach, I have worked with technologies such as React, Laravel, React Native, MySQL, Oracle, among others. My experience ranges from designing and managing databases to developing servers and backends, areas in which I specialize. Among the most relevant projects I have collaborated on are UAGro App and the Prospecting System for Expanding Higher Education Offerings, key platforms that have driven the digital transformation of the university, optimizing its services and facilitating access to technology for the university community.

During my last year as a student at the Autonomous University of Guerrero (UAGro), I was part of an academic support program where I taught Java classes to other higher education students. Through this program, I was selected to help my peers strengthen their programming skills, specifically in Java and software development concepts. My role included explaining data structures and principles of object-oriented programming, using practical projects to enhance learning. This experience not only allowed me to reinforce my own knowledge but also to develop teaching skills and collaborate with other students.

list.institution: Autonomous University of the State of Guerrero

list.testimonial: Edain is an incredibly talented developer. His ability to tackle complex problems and propose efficient solutions is remarkable.

list.name: Dr. Alfredo Méndez Bahena
list.role: Director of the Faculty of Chemical and Biological Sciences at the Autonomous University of Guerrero
list.testimonial: Edain has been an excellent collaborator during the implementation of the web pages for Conacyt. He has proven to be very professional and dedicated.
